message:
بواجه مشاكل معقدة -وبتحصل على ال production- صعب تتحل بسرعة من غير معرفة مسار الكود، ال miniprofiler حل جزء من المشكلة بس مش بيقدر يوفر صورة واضحة عن مسار الكود
--
حد احتاج يعمل حاجة زي كدة؟
حد جرب PostCharp ؟
story: Ahmed Mozaly shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: How can I add a Trace() to every method call in C#?
caption: stackoverflow.com
description: I am having a hard time tracking down a lock issue, so I would like to log every method call's entry and exit. I've done this before with C++ without having to add code to every method. Is this pos...

data.message:
PostSharp
 هيساعدك عشان تتابع مسار الكود فعلا ، وبمجهود بسيط لا يذكر ... هيسجل لك كل دخول وخروج لكل 
method with its parameters
http://www.postsharp.net/blog/post/5-Ways-That-Postsharp-Can-SOLIDify-Your-Code-Logging-and-Auditing

لو الكود بتاعك مبنى على 
IoC Container 
فممكن توصل للنتيجة نفسها باستخدام 
Serilog  
برضه من غير ماتكتب كود لكل 
method 
https://nblumhardt.com/2015/06/contextual-logger-injection-for-autofac/

Serilog 
ممكن يسجل في برنامج 
https://getseq.net/ 
والبرنامج هيساعدك جدا في ربط السياق بسهولة

in Java, you just edit the logging part of the config file, so in C# you just have to set up a logging framework where you can change the logging level from configuration, I wouldn't go to production otherwise'
my main concerns is 'profiling', as some complex issues happens on production, to catch it, I need to know the code flow with parameters in each step

regular logging frameworks didn't seem to fully help in such situation, I reached to aspect-oriented-programming frameworks
but I'm not sure is such issue (logging code flow) really needs AOP framework or I'm missing something here
through configuration you tell the logging where to inject, so in normal conditions only on errors
in debugging you configure to log each entry and exit from a method
Postsharp عشان DI بس لازم الكود بتاعك من البدايه بيستخدمها

P.S. "regular" logging frameworks do use dependency injection I presume or else you will have to call a method in your code each time you need to write something to the log which I presume you do not do.

Postsharp لا يستدعي تغيير في الكود او يتطلب IoC container
كل ماعليك هو وضع 
Logging attribute around your target class, or around  your assembly in assembly.cs file
And then entry and exit events will be triggered for each method call in your application

In the event handler you can log whatever you need, the event args has the method arguments too

If you combine his with serilog and seq then you will have clear idea whats going on on your environment

I dont know if the performance will be impacted by AOP but i believe it will not.
Many production environments are using postsharp with  logging and they manage the logging level as needed
طب هو فيه فريم ورك يعمل لوج للايرورز ويبعتها ميل مثلا ؟
